Reviews.Title: “Tropical low key get away”
Reviews.Author: jkjkmore
Reviews.Content: Great weekend get away. Decided not to stay with the big chains and came upon this hotel on Trip Advisor. Only able to stay one night, but if schedule was open would have stayed longer. Sarah took my reservation and greeted me at the desk when we arrived (great representative for the property). The hotel decor was tropical "retro" - in a good way. My wife and I loved it. We travelled with our two teenage sons who enjoyed the beachfront access and pool. We stayed in a two bedroom oceanfront efficiency (room 45) that had ample room and two porches overlooking the ocean and pool. The room was clean and the kitchenette was well equipped with plates, cups, etc... Need to bring your own coffee and extras (but there is a coffee maker). The hotel has several scheduled activities and we met families that had been coming to this hotel for years. It's about 2-3 miles to the main boardwalk (that's not what we came for). Everyone on the staff we met, went out of there way to make our experience enjoyable. We would definetly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beach House is one of a kind!”
Reviews.Author: Fireproof1
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay with the wife & 5 boys this weekend. Trust me when I say there is nothing like the Beach House at Tropical Manor. From the Flamingo with shades & a sombero that greets you, to the bright pink "brady bunch" shag carpet, it is truly one of a kind. The beach house is perfect because you are right next to the beach, pool, shuffle board, etc. but it has a very private feel with it's own driveway & patio with an awesome view. The room was very clean & fully stocked except for paper products & salt & pepper. So, bring your own paper plates, napkins, & maybe a roll of softer tp.........just saying. :) The staff was very pleasant & helpful. All in all, we had a wonderful time & plan on returning soon. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret of Daytona Shores”
Reviews.Author: Sheri H
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a lot of places all over the world and have not experienced a better place to play.e ocean.The staff go out of their way to make sure you feel at home. Each and every room has a view of the ocean no matter the location. It is easy to walk to restaurants, shops and of course the beach. I will be back to visit for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Aimerz04
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here w my family every year since I was 9. I'm going to be 32 and am now bringing my kids. The walk to the beach is short and it's so peaceful and quiet here . The room we like the best is 42 and it's ocean front 2 bedroom . It's a nice quaint room but could use just some newer appliances, television and sofa. Aside from that it's still nice just getting dated. I'm a clean freak so I always check out cleanliness as soon as we check in. I did end up washing the blankets because they had syrup on them and hadn't been washed so that kinda sucked but the bathroom and kitchen were very clean. Normally the front desk people are friendly and helpful but I thi we caught her on a bad day because she was pretty short with us . We still love it here though and plan to continue coming.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: nat61
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of may with my family and parents, we come from England and have been coming to daytona for about 13 years. This is the best place we have stayed and it's the best place on Daytona beach by far, it's spotless,rooms are fantastic pool area is great and just steps from the beach. Will definitely be returning next year!! Thanks for a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: tony d
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 17 years ago, it was great then. Came back in first week of march '12 with 3 teenaged boys and it was even better. Stayed in 3 bdr suite, beachfront - what a view. Room was large, very clean and staff was extremely accomodating. We had a great time and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Tropica Manor back in the 60's.”
Reviews.Author: marjurbana
Reviews.Content: Use to stay at Tropical Manor back in the middle 60's through 1975. Was always a very nice family place. Then stayed again in the middle 80's through 1997. Wonderful fond memories of this place. Audrey is and always has been a very gracious lady to her visitors. I miss her place very much. My last visit was was in 2000 but I know the quality is the same now as it was back. Marjorie Corray Seaman

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, clean, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: FatEddieCS
Reviews.Content: I picked this place based on the reviews I read here on TripAdvisor. We were certainly not disappointed!! The staff we dealt with was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We had two of the garden cottage rooms. Each had a bedroom, bath, kitchen, and living area. The bedroom space was a little tight, but we slept comfortably. The pool area and beach access were great. I personally prefer the Gulf beaches more than the Atlantic, but this was a nice location on the beach. It is very family-friendly. The outdoor decor is quite an eclectic collection. Overall - unique, clean, and friendly. I would definitely stay here again if I was visiting this area.

Reviews.Title: “Life's good in Daytona Beach, enjoy everyday of it..it is so short !!!”
Reviews.Author: HollandGoes
Reviews.Content: Daytona Beach is a popular destination for beach-goers from around the world. There are many local attractions surrounding the Tropical Manor area. (Daytona Beach Shores ) That’s what it is making it the perfect family vacation spot for everyone AND every age. Bring your ( grand) mother , kids , wife and the rest of the family to Daytona, the will love this place. A great place for lovers of water sports and its easy accessible beach ! If you do not like the beach, the big pool area is nice too. The Tropical Manor is a beautiful beach-front, lovely hotel and very laid-back. Beds are comfortable and the bathroom is nice and clean. The pillows were comfy. The staff is very nice.. I always have a great experience at the Tropical.Year after year… For leisurely guests, the famous beach ( always open !!), various museums ,galleries, the Volusia Mall and the convention centre are within close reach. Entertainment ,bars , spring break, NASCAR auto racing, Bike week ,dining ,nightlife venues and shopping opportunities abound in many locations. My favorite?? Bare feet on the white sand beach when the sun comes up in the morning… Love it !! I do enjoy the gorgeous sunshine everyday …that’s haroldslife. I loved it Harold van Deventer Made in Holland byharold.com

Reviews.Title: “Unusual, enjoyable and great value”
Reviews.Author: Wyvernian
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Audrey's Tropical Manor. This is a standout concept motel - pastel shades, lovely garden and all next to those endless Daytona sands. Our room was far bigger than we imagined it would be, with fun and unusual decorations (mostly involving parrots!). All impeccably clean too. There's a nice pool and our kids were delighted with the games on offer -we were able to introduce them to shuffleboard (not something we play in the UK!). Staff are friendly and helpful. Great value for money and well worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “So Nice, We Came Back”
Reviews.Author: oneluckyb
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at TM. Last year we stayed on the wonderful reviews here on Trip Advisor and after enjoying ourselves so much, we decided to do it again this year. Tropical Manor is a throwback to simpler times in Florida with pink buildings and murals. Both times that we have stayed it has been quiet and relaxing. Most of the guest we have seen have been older. We are in our 30's and everyone else we see is probably 50 and older. Room are well kept but I imagine soon it may be time to replace carpets and curtains, as they are beginning to show a bit of wear and tear. The pool is always at the perfect temperature and the beach is just steps away. You won't find a better place for the money in my opinion. Like my title says...we liked it so much we came back.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: ERtech0905
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times. I am a third generation guest. My husband and I always come to Daytona for our anniversary every year and stay at tropical manor. This is one of the cleanest places we have ever stayed at. They have everything you need in a room plus more. this place is small but it's perfect if you want to stay somewhere quiet. This trip, we were threatened with possibly not making it to Daytona due to an illness. Last Minute, we decided to go. Although I was terribly ill for the first 5 days of our trip and didn't get to enjoy one minute out in the sun, we still made it out every evening to see the ocean, walk in the sand, and pick up shells. On our last day, Audrey, the owner was gracious enough to let us stay the entire day in our room and on the sundeck until the evening hours. there were hardly any guests left so we had the place practically to ourselves. Audrey even came down and joined us by the pool! We appreciated this time, since I was unable to thoroughly enjoy myself at first. I felt great the last day and my husband and I left feeling very happy. This is what true hospitality is all about! Thank you again Audrey and tropical manor. We will be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alabama-Dora
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in April. We enjoyed our stay. Our room was very spacious. We stayed in Room #19 above the office. Street View but all the windows were great. Felt more like a little apartment than a hotel room. Highly recommend this place. You must walk around the hotel and take it all in. The decorations are adorable. Pool was nice. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Vacatime23
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, conveniently located, no frills hotel. I stress clean! I was in room 18 which is small but has a mini kitchen. Perfect for one or 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional place”
Reviews.Author: davespad
Reviews.Content: I work for a national children's wish-granting organization, and I sent a family to Daytona Beach for Race Week. The family had the experience of a lifetime, and absolutely RAVED about the service they received at Tropical Manor. The owner, Audrey, called me to see if there was anything special she could do for the family -- and she did. I am most impressed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the headline!!”
Reviews.Author: ERtech0905
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at tropical manor every year..since we have been married, we have chosen it to be our anniversary destination... It's clean and safe.. Friendly staff.. Owners live on sight... Wifi... Heated pools... Lots of outdoor space and small sitting areas tucked away if you want to be alone... Close to everything....there is nothing negative about this place at all. We will continue staying at this place! We will recommend it to anyone! Growing up, as a family, we have all been coming here for the past 30 years and now my husband and I are starting a tradition!

Reviews.Title: “Wonder place - Tropical Manor”
Reviews.Author: watch0pad
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable stay in Tropical Manor. Our room is well-decorated and very clean as well. We were lucky to get an ocean front room. That position gave us a great view of nature outside, especially during morning. They have a separate pool for kids, this ensure their safety while swimming without their parents. Both pools for adults and kids are very clean. Also, there are tables to accommodate family near the barbecue pit. Another good thing about the places is… most areas or establishments are within our reach. We just walked from one place to another without spending too much time. All workers there are friendly. They attended to our needs in a fast pace. It’s a wonderful traditional family hotel that everybody will surely love.

Reviews.Title: “Casual & Fun”
Reviews.Author: buoyheads
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to Daytona Beach the end of June. Tropical Manor was a nice surprise. We had the king size room and that was the most comfortable bed I've slept on in years! We had a mini frig (which could only hold our bottles of water and soda) and a mini microwave (we never used). My only complaint was the lack of a coffee maker. ugh. Must have coffee, so we buzzed across the street to 7-11 and got our coffee and donut for breakfast. The pool was very clean and they had a kiddie pool separate from the adult pool. There was a barbeque pit with a picnic table and plenty of lawn chairs and a few tables with umbrellas. Other than that there was no shade so that wasn't very good for us. A couple of nights they had a big movie screen up outside for the kids to watch. In the afternoon there was bingo. We were usually in the ocean cooling off. The owner and worker bees were friendly and helpful re: restaurants, etc. This motel wasn't crowded when we went. I would definitely go back if I drove and brought an umbrella. ha!

Reviews.Title: “A great family spot”
Reviews.Author: tw21
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Tropical Manor in Daytona Beach with our family for several years now. This is one of the best kept and child friendly places on the beach. There are a variety of units available. We usually stay in a 2 bedroom efficiency. From the front office staff to the grounds crew and housekeepers, people are universally friendly and really take pride in their jobs. The place is meticulously maintained, safe and convenient to the beach. There is an oceanfront grill available for guests use, a full size pool as well as a smaller kiddie pool. Highly reccommended for families.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this place - and I am VERY picky!!”
Reviews.Author: MelsColorado
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this particular hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. (I am very picky when it comes to hotel selection.) Cleanliness and comfort are both extremely important to me. The ladies in the office were very helpful and accomodating. We rented a room with 2 double beds and we asked for, and received, a roll-a-way as well. (The double beds are a little small for 2 big guys.) Anyway, all the rooms are different so you can ask for what you need at the time of booking. Our room didn't have an ocean view, but from the front door we had a little patio and could see the ocean. The thing we noticed the most is how CLEAN the room was! The entire room, including the bathoom was SPOTLESS. The room smelled fresh as well! There was a small table in the room, a kitchen sink, a stove (with oven) and microwave and fridge. The cupboards were stocked with cooking utensils, pans, dishes and silverware. They have a laptop that they will let you take to your room, or to one of the Wi Fi hotspots for personal use. This came in very handy! The kids really enjoyed the on-site pool. The beach near the hotel was very nice! The hotel is actually in South Daytona Beach, so a couple of miles south of the pier. I found this to be the perfect location as it wasn't crowded and it was quiet! This hotel has been owned by the same people for over 50 years. Quite impressive! They have done a FANTASTIC job keeping the property up. Very nice grounds - very unique! We saw many people walking along the beach stop and look up at the hotel and comment. There is a grocery store about a block away, which is very convenient. Sure, you could stay at a fancy high rise, but why do that when you can have the comforts of home, first rate service, and a view that can't be beat?! If you like the fancy 5 star resorts, you may want to look elsewhere, but if you are are traveling with a family and like the smaller atmosphere and no-nonsense frills, you will not be disappointed in this hotel! We liked it so much, we stayed an extra night! We would DEFINITELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: daytonabeach001
Reviews.Content: We are going to the Tropical Manor for the last 10 years. We being here from 31 july until 4 august and 16 august until 21 august. This is the best place to stay in the Daytona Beach area. STOP looking for something better hotel, you are on the right place ! Every room is differend, also in size, big group no problem. They have cookies day, once a week music, movies on a big screen, they have also bingo with nice price's. Nice clean pool and right on the beach. Very friendly staff. Franc vd Nieuwendijk (the Netherlands)

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: beachtripbum
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Daytona, Beach, Fla with my Mother and Father since I was born, after,Pleasant Green next door was taken in by Perry's we stayed for a while there, but came over to Tropical Manor and been there each and every year since. I always meet up with me other family aunt, uncle, cousins, and friends, there at the same time also..I will be there this year again, and although my Father has passed, and I dont see Al, and Bobbie, our miad for many years. I still see Dave, and Ms Audrey, and the rest of the staff, and friends again. I will be fifty two this year, and am still here. Cant wait to next week. Great place for anyone to stay and be at home....

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, clean, safe, friendly place in the best part of Daytona”
Reviews.Author: Joeker277
Reviews.Content: We love this place! My sister and I travel over from Orlando for weekends and have stayed at the Tropical Manor many times. Various types of rooms, efficiencies, and suites are available--good for families, couples, friends, whatever. (The motel's website has detailed descriptions and pictures of the different configurations.) The oceanfront suites are really special: I like the upstairs ones because (when it's not too hot) you can leave the doors open and get ocean breezes and the sounds of the surf all night. Staff is always helpful and accommodating. Pool is small but rarely crowded. Grills are available for cookouts. The Tropical Manor is on a lovely section of Daytona Beach Shores---the quieter, non-teen-oriented section of Daytona. The only negative, and I feel I should mention it, is that the property is not fully accessible. One time I was partially disabled after a knee operation, I had some difficulty with the stairs that take you from the parking lot to the main part of the motel and those that lead from the rooms to the pool area. This motel is attractive and unique; they have many repeat customers that come year after year. Therefore, they don't discount as much as a lot of other places. So if you're shopping by price, you probably won't end up here. But if you're willing and able to spend a little more for the cleanliness, pleasant grounds and atmosphere, and excellent service, this would be a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “BEST KEPT SECRET ON THE STRIP~ A MUST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: imagoddess
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here, Perfect getaway spot for families or a place to relax. Clean, no bugs, great staff, great view, heated pool. Quiet. Cozy. Bring coffee. Enjoyed the visit VERY MUCH! A short few feet to the beach. Barbeque grill. No bugs. Kiddie pool. Would definately visit again!!! DO NOT HESITATE TO STAY HERE! Cozy rooms..great maid service. On top of it groundskeeper. Friendly staff. Perfect place to relax. NO LOUD guests. Very homey and relaxing experiance. Stay there, you won't be disapointed!!!!!! A*****!!!!!!!!! Will visit again!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect family reunion”
Reviews.Author: Jeanchestercounty
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my aunt’s 90th birthday the family decided to meet in Florida so that she could once again celebrate the big day with a skydive in DeLand, FL. The Tropical Manor was found by a cousin who lives in DeLand. Upon first seeing the literature and the web site I was a bit worried about the funkiness of the place but as soon as we all began to arrive we were truly delighted. Our room was facing right out to the ocean as well as side views to the pool, shuffleboard, outdoor grill with picnic area and outdoor sunning. Because the Tropical Manor is family oriented (do not allow “spring breakers”) the rooms were spacious and well equipped. I think all of the rooms have at least a small kitchenette and many include a stove and oven with microwaves and more than one refrigerator! We shared a room with our son and daughter-in-law and their 10 month old daughter and we were all very comfortable. With a wide range of interests among the family (48 of us) there was always something to do either right there or an easy walk, or short drive away. The rooms were so very clean….I wondered how they accomplished that being right on the beach, but they certainly did! A find for sure!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Tropical Manor”
Reviews.Author: jrd77
Reviews.Content: We (myself, husband, sister, mother) stayed at the Tropical Manor last week (July 10-15) in a cute little 2 bedroom apartment across the street from the office (#51). It was wonderful. First, check in was a breeze. The staff were friendly and efficient. The only thing you should be prepared for is paying for the room up front. We were not aware of this policy, but given the reputation Daytona used to have, it makes sense. After we checked in we got "the $0.50 tour." We were shown other rooms on the property, where the laundry was, location of pool and grilling area, shuffleboard area, etc. We were then taken to our apartment and shown around. It had a smallish kitchen area, a comfortable living room (room for 4), a nice and newly redone bathroom (with GREAT water pressure by the way) and the 2 bedrooms. One bedroom had 2 twin beds and the other a queen. The quilts and sheets were obviously new-ish, but were comfortable, as were the beds. There was plenty of shelving and dresser space, as well as coat-hangers in the closets. Neither bedroom had a TV, but the living room did have a small tv with cable and a dvd player. There was also wireless internet and an emergency 911 telephone (no actual landline though). Cleaning service are M-S, no Sunday service, but that was fine. There were plenty of towels and the trash was wonderful because there were two bins below the kitchen sink, one for recyclables and one for trash. Most amenities needed in a kitchen were there, no paper towels or dishwashing soap but everything else was available. The rooms were very clean. The pool area was also very clean and the pool was pretty large considering the small size of the property. There was also a grilling area you could sign up for and direct beach access. Honestly, the review thus far does not do this place justice. The individual touches, the fact that the same couple has owned the property for 51 years, the head-maid who had been there for 23 years, the friendly staff, the regulars, the location...I do not plan on staying anywhere else in Daytona ever again. That's it, I'm converted ~ and I hope you will be too.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Oasis in Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: PlannedSpontaneity
Reviews.Content: In this age of the high-rise condo there are fewer and fewer small, family-owned hotels left on the beach. When we arrived at Tropical Manor we knew we had found a piece of "Old Florida". When we arrived we were given a tour of the property and shown several rooms. The hotel was brightly painted. The rooms were all neat as a pin and spotless. We finally chose a second floor room that was oceanfront. The balcony had a table and chairs. The room had two full sized beds and a separate kitchenette with a full-sized refrigerator, a small stove, sink, microwave, plates, utensils, pots, and pans. They also provided dish washing liquid! The pool was heated, but the ocean breezes in November made it difficult to swim (but not impossible!). There was shuffleboard, a nice sundeck, and a great grill area. Everything was clean and kept in its place. The owner lives on the property and has owned it since the 50's. There is a sign in the office that says, "This property is not for sale. As long as you keep staying with us it will stay that way." We can only pray that it does.

Reviews.Title: “White Glove????”
Reviews.Author: MommySnob
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very charming and campy, but overrun with sand mites--the front desk said they were native to Florida and there was nothing they could do. I've stayed oceanfront in Florida and never had to share a room with tiny bugs before!! The towels had stains on them and the room was not swept for the 4 days we were there. I read the reviews and they said "clean"---but no way!!! Maybe I'm just a snob-but I believe they charge enough to sweep and give CLEAN towels!

Reviews.Title: “Great beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: rkc7737
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at a great spot on the beach if you are looking for a less congested area and easy access to rentals for lounge chairs/umbrella, food and beach activity concessions. We booked at the last minute so we did get a smaller room than we would have liked. There is no maid service on Sunday but you can go to the office and get extra towels, soap, toilet paper. We would stay here again but only if we could get a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Should be Tropical Paradise Manor!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumWantabee
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place that caters to its visitors, (homebaked?) cookies left once a week, a DJ on Thursdays, staff that couldn't be more friendly or helpful and the cleanest place I've ever stayed including the largest of the most expensive. It is a very small place that gives it a family feel almost like you are visiting your family. We found this place about 5 years ago, and return every year. We make the reservations a year in advance--that's how much we love it! Sitting outside our room on our porch, we can see the ocean, the pool and BBQ area. Put on your swim suit walk right out your door within a minute on the beach in the ocean or mere seconds to the pool. I could not even think of doing that at one of those highrises down the street. The owner (only know her as Audrey) and the staff is very dedicated in making your stay as wonderful as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great family motel”
Reviews.Author: blessedblonde
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for families. Friendly staff and colorful rooms decorated with different themes. We almost stayed at the hawaiin inn but quickly canceled our reservation with them because of bad reviews. The tropical manor is very clean, no partying or loud guest. Mostly older people and families. Right on the beach. Small kiddie pool, bbq area that you can reserve.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katib84
Reviews.Content: My grandparents, my sister (15) and I (22) are actually staying at the hotel right now. I am enjoying my stay so much I just had to leave a review of this great little place. Sure, pulling up from down the street I was thinking to myself "What kind of place did my grandmother book this time?" My sister and I unpacked as the grandparents went to check-in. They were back quicker than I had anticipated! Having done a lot of travelling over the years to many types of resorts in the United States, Caribbean, Mexico and abroad I have never seen that process go so fast. We were originally booked into a "double room." We entered room number 11 and I was taken aback. The room was small but very clean. We had all the amenities we needed: mini fridge, TV, microwave. When you take a beach vacation how often are you just hanging around in the room anyways? We didn't care that the room was small! However, the owner of the hotel told us that in the morning we could switch rooms to the one next door because it was a bit bigger. (All of the rooms are a little different in some way) When the next morning came around she asked us to come and view another room that may "suit our needs better." All I can say about the room she showed us is WOW!!! Walking in the front door there is the living room. It has a recliner chair, sofa with pull out bed, TV (with cable), closet, and a three drawers. The next room in is the FULL KITCHEN! Four burner stove and oven, big fridge, big sink, stocked with ALL the dishes (plates, cups, pots/pans, forks/spoons/knives). Then, there is the bedroom. Two double beds, six drawer dresser, closet and phone. Around the corner is the bathroom. There is no tub, only a shower. The back is a patio with a table and a few chairs. We are located right in the courtyard. There is a cute little gazebo out there and around the corner to the pool and beach! Speaking of the pool... it is heated! Which may not sound too appealing in the summer months but it really adds a little something extra. Instead of hesitating and inching your way into the water... you can just jump right in to the luke-warm-bath-like water. VERY NICE!!! There are a lot of chairs so you don't have to worry about not getting one when you want to sleep in a little bit on your vacation. There is also a little gazebo out by the pool. Thursday nights they have a DJ out there. They also have a BBQ area right by the beach and you can reserve it to cook out with your family and friends. They have several picnic tables and you can sit out with your own sandwiches and enjoy the ocean front. I am not sure if this review is helpful or not... but I just had to share my experience. This hotel is not your average beach hotel. There are not that many rooms here and you really feel that you are appreciated here. Even the maintence workers wish you a good morning! If you are looking for a family friendly, small hotel on the beach and an unforgettable experience then you should really check this place out. I promise you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “loved this place”
Reviews.Author: mittens82755
Reviews.Content: stayed at the tropical manor motel in daytona beach shores for 4 nights. may 24th-may 28th. i was pleasantly taken by surprise by this motel. very clean. management lives by their motto where the customer comes first. it may not be the biggest place on the beach but far the most beautiful place i have stayed at so far. very colorful on the deck by poolside.they have the most upbeat theme. Tropical it is. the buildings are very colorful as well. the room i had was very spacious with all that i needed- the only one thing they dont provide is the coffee for the coffee maker tho you will find filters in the cupboard. you bring your own coffee. that was ok by me. the balcony on the lot side was very much lit up at night so you could sit out and enjoy the weather.. they had plenty of washers/ dryers outside to accomodate their customers.so all in all it was fantastic. the beach side was fabulous. right on the ocean. you couldnt ask for more. their prices are reasonable. if you have a problem the maint. man is right there to help out with anything that needs to be fixed right away.the managers are very accomodating for anything you need. they have thurs.night DJ to provide music and dancing by the pool in the gazebo. with the rain that fell on that night and he didnt get to play for 2 hrs the management had him come back the next night to finish where he left off. they want their customers to enjoy their stays there. the rooms are cleaned daily. you just have to bring your shampoo with you. they dont provide that as well. all in all i can only say- try it out and you will be pleasantly surprised. if you have a room on the 2nd flr - you have to walk the stairs. they are steep. there is no elevator to most of the 2nd flrs. but that was ok. Book a stay there and you will be sure to go back again. they have plenty of beach lounge chairs on the patio for a day or longer in the sun by the poolside. and a bar-b- q - for anyone wanting a cookout with a picnic table to accomodate your families. ENJOY ! I DID AND WILL RETURN AGAIN ON MY FUTURE STAYS IN DAYTONA BEACH- SO. ATLANTIC SIDE .

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: detredwings
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the tropical manor inn Jan 23 and 24th 2006. We only paid $55.00 a night. That being said we thought it was a very nice hotel. We just had a room with 2 dbl beds, shower in bathroom and a small fridge and microwave. It was quite clean as far as the grout in the bathroom, bedding etc, the only thing that wasn't clean was the tile floor, someone obviously forgot to sweep it. (sandy) Overall though the grounds are kept very nice and clean. It is located right on the beach, and also has a nice heated pool. Our air conditioner didn't work well that was our only other complaint besides the dirty floor. We met quite a few older folks who have been going there for 17 years or more and stay a full month, so they must be doing something right!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family (four kids and two adults) stayed at the hotel for a week in Aug. The staff was WONDERFUL. We called lost in Orlando and they were more than willing to stay open late until we got there to check in (2 am) and gave the best directions. The room was great, we stayed in room 50 and had more than enough room for all of us and our own private walk way to the beach. We will definitely be staying here again when we visit Daytona Beach. Thanks so much for a wonderful experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Best little place in town”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been going to Daytona for about 20 years now. For the past 15 years Tropical Manor has been our Tropical Paradise one week out of the year. The people who run Tropical Manor are extremely polite, willing to help if there is a need. The rooms are kept cleaner than most peoples homes. Just be careful if you have trouble climbing stairs because some of the rooms don't have elevators that go to them and the steps are a little steep. Over all we have always been pleased with the Tropical Manor and will stay there for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “cancelled reservations,raised prices(after i made reservation) and bad service,”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: on june 4th,2004 my wife made a resevation at the tropical manor from a referral from her cousin(who had stayed there) for a week. we was quoted by the motel for $595 plus tax for a week to stay.(this was not only quoted to my wife but to her cousin as well). we paid our $200 deposit and when we got the reservation confirm. they had raised the price $200 more dollars. of course i called and was told that they had to change it and we was misquoted. i asked to speak to the manager and was told he was not there(this was on the 14th of june), but the man i was speaking to told me her could do the room for $650 for the week and i agreed for that. but on the 15th a girl called and said our room was cancelled due to the fact it was over booked. my question to this is how was this room booked twice by me and then it was gone, i think they tried to jack the prices after i made the reservations. i then asked to speak to the owner and she was not thereand then the manager and he was not there. i asked dave(the man on the phone) when he would be there and he told after 5,so i called after 5 and asked for (al green-mgr) and was asked who was calling. after i tokd dave who it was,he notifeid me the manager was not available. i asked for him to call me back but was not told that he would not. i was also notified by dave that my business with them was over.and that now i have to find reservations for my family and i(2 adults and 3kids ) for a week of june 26th. all we wanted to do was take our baby to the beach for the first time.But the bottom line to all this is that quoted the price to not just one person but to two people, and then after I paid the deposit raised the price. But when I said something and questioned this I was treated very badly and my reservations was cancelled. If you have any questions over this please call me at home (478)956-1985.

Reviews.Title: “i love "TROPICAL MANOR"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Tropical Manor is the #1 place to stay in Daytona. It is small and thats what I LOVE about it. The rooms are perfect! You can have a fun family vacation for a good price. The kiddie pool and the other pool are sooo much fun... and you only have to walk a few feet and you are on the beach!~!~ the people are so nice. Everything is clean.... i will be at the Tropical Manor on June 16th. I cant wait!~

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Family!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Tropical Manor is the perfect family paradise! The ocean front rooms are beautiful, and we are just feet away from the ocean! It is clean and gives you a great sense of "home away from home". The kiddie pool and pool are a great way for the entire family to enjoy the water! Very clean too! Everything is within walking distance, including your groceries!! I will be back!!

HotelInfo.Name: Tropical Manor
HotelInfo.Address: 2237 S. Atlantic Ave., At Bonner Ave., Daytona Beach, FL
